text: Identity management and access control is a discipline that enables
the right individuals to access the right resources at the right times for the right reasons.
With AWS identity services,
you can manage your workforce and customer identities as well as their access to AWS services and resources.
AWS Identity and Access Management, also known as IAM,
enables you to securely control access to your services and resources
by assigning granular permissions to allow
and deny your workforce access to AWS resources.
IAM also makes it simple
to audit policies and continuously monitor them to help refine permissions.
AWS Single Sign-On centralizes
managing access to multiple AWS accounts and business applications
using an identity provider of your choice;
it gives your workforce easy access to their accounts and applications from one place.
With AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory,
you can join Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS
for SQL Server instances to your AD domain to support your Windows workloads.
Amazon Cognito assists with
customer identity management giving you secure user sign-up,
sign-in, and access control for your customer-facing web and mobile applications.
AWS Identity Services provide flexible options
for where and how you manage employee, partner, and customer identities.
To learn more, go to aws.amazon.com/identity
